title: Devastated mum of teen suicide victim says paedo grooming daughter knew about overdose but 'left her to die'
text:

The heartbroken mum of a teenage suicide victim who was groomed by a sex predator believes the paedo left her daughter to die and "used her for kicks". 
Britney Mazzoncini, 16, was found dead in July after suffering a torrent of vile online bullying . 
Devastated mum Annette McKenzie now says paedophile Barry Duffin – locked up this week for abusing three schoolgirls – knew Britney had taken an overdose but didn’t call for help. 
Annette has shared private messages between the two, showing the chilling moment Britney revealed she had taken all of her prescription medication and was struggling to breathe. 
Annette said that instead of calling for help, Duffin continued to speak to her and message her until she died at her home in Hillington, Glasgow, the Daily Record reports. 
Duffin, 18, from Paisley, was given four-and-a-half years and branded “a risk to women” after being convicted of abusing a 13-year-old girl and “wearing down” two girls aged 14 and 15 until they agreed to have sex. Read More Mum's agony after teen took own life by overdosing on anti-depressants given during secret GP visits Britney Mazzoncini pictured with her mum Annette Mckenzie 
Sentencing him, Sheriff David Pender said it was clear the girls had not wanted to have sex with him but he wore them down to the point they felt obliged to cooperate with his demands. 
Annette had never heard of Duffin until police – who had taken Britney’s mobile phone after her death – found messages between the pair and asked her how Britney had met him. 
Annette, 35, said: “I didn’t know who he was. I have asked everyone who knew Britney how she met this man but no one can tell me. 
“The only conclusion I have come to is that he has seen a comment Britney made on Facebook then contacted her directly through that.” 
When the phone was returned to Annette, she checked Britney’s Facebook Messenger. She was devastated to find Duffin spoke to her daughter by phone and on Facebook Messenger until her last breath. Britney Mazzoncini's texts to Barry Duffin (Photo: Daily Record) 
Annette said: “I found out this Barry had invited Britney and a friend to his house in Paisley two days before she died. He offered to organise and pay for a taxi to pick them up and take them there. 
“Looking back through the messages, I can see he was contacting her, telling Britney his problems to make her feel sorry for him. She was messaging back, trying to be supportive. 
“On July 5, Britney fell out with her boyfriend. She had mentioned this on social media to her friends and all of a sudden Duffin was there messaging her, asking what happened then inviting her to his house. He played on her vulnerability.” 
Annette couldn’t believe what she was seeing when she realised Britney had messaged Duffin and told him she had taken an overdose. Annette said: “It was a strange exchange. He seemed to know what was going on. 
“There were messages and a Facebook call. Britney seemed to hang up on him and came back with the message, ‘I can’t breathe.’ Sick paedo Barry Duffin was messaging Britney while she was overdosing from prescription drugs (Photo: Police handout) 
“She told him she had taken an overdose then said her insides were burning and she was in pain. He did nothing.” 
Duffin’s reply said: “I’m away to do it now.” This made Annette consider whether there was a suicide pact but only Britney went through with it. 
Annette said: “Her friend, who had visited Barry Duffin at his house with Britney, was messaging her too, saying she’s looked up on Google what would happen if she took all her medication. 
“One of the messages had Britney saying her friend looked it up and ‘my heart’s going to stop beating’. 
“When Britney goes quiet, around 3am, he panics and demands she texts him back immediately. But she was gone, because I found Britney at 3.17am.” Britney was found dead by her mum in July last year after she took her own life 
Annette has kept the messages to try to piece together who knew what happened and why. 
She said: “For now, all I know is that this Barry knew and spoke to Britney while she ended her life instead of helping. I need to know if he really left her to die and used her for kicks.” 
Annette is now torn apart, wondering whether her daughter might have been saved had someone raised the alarm. 
She said: “I believe if we had got to Britney, even five or 10 minutes sooner, that we could have done something to save her.” 
Annette is heading a campaign to stop GPs prescribing strong mental health medication to under-18s without their parents’ knowledge. Read More Girl found dead after being bullied on social media posted haunting Facebook status weeks earlier Tragic Britney suffered a torrent of vile online bullying (Photo: Facebook/Annette Mckenzie) 
She was unaware her daughter had made secret visits to her GP and had been prescribed a month’s supply of strong anxiety drugs. 
In November, Annette launched a petition calling for a change in the law and next week she will speak to a Holyrood committee about the law she wants to call Britney’s Plea. She said: “Kids as young as 14 can be given these strong meds if the doctor sees fit, without our knowledge or consent. 
“We thought our daughter was safe under our roof but there was a danger there we had no idea about.” 
Samaritans (116 123) operates a 24-hour service available every day of the year. If you prefer to write down how you’re feeling, or if you’re worried about being overheard on the phone, you can email Samaritans at . 
Childline (0800 1111) runs a helpline for children and young people in the UK. Calls are free and the number won’t show up on your phone bill. 
PAPYRUS (0800 068 41 41) is a voluntary organisation supporting teenagers and young adults who are feeling suicidal. 
Depression Alliance is a charity for people with depression. It doesn’t have a helpline, but offers a wide range of useful resources and links to other relevant information. http://www.depressionalliance.org/ 
Students Against Depression is a website for students who are depressed, have a low mood or are having suicidal thoughts. Bullying UK is a website for both children and adults affected by bullying. http://studentsagainstdepression.org/ Like us on Facebook
